p: However, previous preliminary analyses (data not shown) highlighted a lower content of protein (5â€“6% less out of the total d.m.) and a corresponding increase in the fat amount, in the BSF biomass obtained from larvae reared on VMD, in comparison to SD. Spranghers et al. [ 26] also investigated the amino acid content in BSF pre-pupae, accordingly with the different rearing substrates. Glutamic acid, aspartate and arginine are the most represented amino acids in our BSF biomass reared on VMD ( Table 6), while the same authors, on a similar substrate, individuated glutamic acid, aspartate, and leucine as the most relevant amino acids.
